intro: Amblyanthera versicolor var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-flowered amblyanthera, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, colorful flowers that vary in hue. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
